bibl.title: Charles W. Nordstrom v. William H. Moyer. Notice of Appeal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
div1.p: IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF CHARLES W. NORDSTROM FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RELIEF THEREON.
To the State of Washington, and to Hon. W.H. Moyer, Sheriff of King County, State of Washington, and to Hon.Jas.F.McElroy, Prosecuting Attorney for King County, State of Washington.

Comes now the Petitioner, Charles W.Nordstrom, and appeals the above entitled cause and the whole thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the City of Washington, District of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and more especially appeals from that certain order made and entered in the above entitled cause on the 3rd day of April A.D.1897, by the Honorable C.H.Hanford, Judge, sitting as the Circuit Court, denying the Petition of Petitioner for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and refusing to grant the said Writ of Habeas Corpus as in his said Petition prayed.

And you will please take notice that the record and proceedings upon the said Petition will be duly certified through the said above entitled Court to the said Supreme Court of the United States at the next regular term thereof upon said above named appeal.
div1.ab: Jas Hamilton Lewis, Attorney for Petitioner.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING
div1.p: Copy of the within Notice of appeal received, together with a duly certified copy of the order allowing the appeal in said cause, and due service of the same is hereby acknowledged this 6th day of April A.D. 1897,
div1.ab: Wm H. Moyer Sheriff of King County, State of Washington.
Jas F McElroy Prosecuting Attorney for King County, State of Washington.
div1.p: In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In re application of Charles W. Nordstrom for Writ of Habeas Corpus, etc.,
div1.ab: Jas. Hamilton Lewis STRATTON, LEWIS & GILMAN
div1.p: Copy of within received and due service of the same acknowledged this day of 1896.
FILED Apr 6 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT. A. REEVES AYRES, CLERK
